title: Mac OS 13.2.1 will not Run Firefox
content:
Last week, Firefox blew up on my Mac. An Apple security window opened up saying my machine was compromised, and I had to uninstall Firefox. Further attempts to install a later version were rebuffed by MAC OS because Firefox was not installed through "The App Store".

There was something about changing my security settings on my Mac to allow Firefox, but I could not find any options specifically relevant to Firefox. I really want to recover the use of Mozilla applications as they are used in routine browser searches, and are my secure web buffer.

Thanks Thomas Booker booker.tl@gmail.com
creator: booker.tl

title: PayPal Pop Ups Not Showing
content:
When I select 'Cancel', to cancel a pre-approved payment in PayPal the pop up appears for a spit second, then disappears, although the site remains blurred out. Clicking the Back arrow takes me back to the pre-approved payments page.

I don't encounter the problem in Google Chrome.

I've added 'https://www.paypal.com' as an exception in Cookies & Site Data, and retarted Firefox before trying to log in again. I've also deleted the PayPal cookies in Firefox before logging in. None of those actions resolved the issue.
creator: rgrpb

title: Outlook for Web not showing Inbox emails. 1st happened today. Have both closed/re-opened browser and restarted laptop. Running 111.0.1 64bit on W11. No issues with Chrome or Edge. Help. Firefox is my main browser

title: How do I totally clear out Firefox memory and reinstall?  I tried what I could, and when it reloaded, it knew all the bookmarks, etc.
content:
I was getting suspicious activity from a website only when using Firefox. I cleared all history, cache, site settings, then I saved my bookmarks in a file (named it something non-default), and deleted the program by uninstalling, trying to erase everything.

When I reinstalled, Firefox gladly announced it had recovered old bookmarks.

How do I erase EVERYTHING from my computer that Firefox knows about, so I can be sure I have a clean install?
creator: backpacker2000

title: Does disabling automatic updates for Add-ons give a notification when a new update is available?
content:
I'm wondering if disabling the automatic updates for Extensions/Add-ons we get any notification when an update is available, without going in the Settings where the Add-ons are listed.

Will I get any notification or indication while browsing that an Extension/Add-on has a new update, if I disable the automatic updates?
creator: ynsc

title: Firefox not printing web pages
content:
My 64-bit Firefox 111.0.1 on Windows 10 no longer prints web pages to any device. It apparently doesn't do anything when I try to print to my default printer (Brother MFC-7360N) or Save to PDF. If I print to Microsoft Print to PDF or Microsoft XPS Document Writer, a 0-byte file is saved to disc.

Firefox print its internal pages correctly, such as the Firefox View tab or the about:profiles page. Pages on the internet, though, don't print.

Other web browsers (Edge and Chrome) print correctly.

I'm not sure when this problem started. I recently uninstalled and reinstalled my printer drivers for 2 Brother printers, but I think Firefox was still printing after that. I subsequently cleared Firefox's startup cache in an effort to fix a problem on a specific website. I'm not sure that this is related.

I cleared Firefox's saved print settings in about:support; ran Firefox in Troubleshoot Mode; ran it with a new blank profile; reset my profile; uninstalled/reinstalled Firefox twice; cleared startup cache again; and rebooted several times. I also installed Firefox Developer Edition 112.0.b9, which shows the same printing failure. Every time, Firefox fails to print a webpage.

Is there anything else I should try?
creator: firefox2283

title: Firefox no longer allows me to use back arrow to amend search argument
content:
I was previously using Firefox on Windows 10 and if I entered a search argument (which was handled by Google) and the results weren't relevant to my query, I could use the back arrow to get to the search argument and amend it. Now I'm on a new Windows 11 machine, I installed Firefox (release 111.0.1), and this ability is gone. Why?

Another, admittedly small, change. On my Windows 10 machine there was a Google icon in the blank space to the left of the space where you enter the url. It was handy for situations where you wished to start a new search using a window that was already open. A workaround of course is to add a Google icon to the line below that, where I have all my other often used sites (the bank, etc.), but why would this have changed?

I assume I was at 111.0.1 in Windows 10 but I have no way to check that out. I was always getting automatic updates in my Windows 10 machine.
creator: tcluster

content:

creator: abrimaal

title: Passwords lost after hard reset
content:
I recently had my computer completely wiped and restarted due to strange glitches. I'm trying to reinstall everything but have run into a problem - i had many passwords saved under a few different emails, and none of them have saved over past the reset. I have memory issues, and cannot remember: 1. if I ever made a Firefox account, 2. what any of my passwords were initially (I relied heavily on the saving feature) and 3. how I even worked multiple emails. My default browser is not Firefox (Windows computer), but I haven't used Edge in so long that any synced over passwords there are either outdated or for things I dont use anymore.

Is there anything I can do to re-add all my lost passwords, or do I just need to go through every website and app and manually reset the passwords?
creator: one.threesevenths

title: Some websites display a dark blue background with very faint and barely visible lettering. Can we set website displays to have simple, black on white backgrounds?
content:
Some websites display a dark blue background with very faint and barely visible lettering. Can we set website displays to have simple, black on white backgrounds? Sometimes, you can highlight lettering, but only by hovering over it (if you can even find it) and sliding the cursor across the lettering.

I am unable to copy a Southwest Airlines website that shows a flight booking for BWI-VPS on April 7 at 6:25am-9:30AM with this dark blue background and very faint lettering to display the times of day of the flights. If you look carefully, you can these times faintly, then hover over and slide the cursor across the times, which will be revealed in white. This is very difficult viewing on such an important site.

Maybe this type of display is the way the website was designed, but if there is a FireFox setting to change the site to black lettering on white background, please tell me how to do this.

Thank you!

Robert
creator: chezmich

title: Stop extension shortcut from resetting upon reloading
content:
There's an add-on that I often need to change one of its settings. Luckily I can assign an extension shortcut to it and it works great. However every-time I reload Firefox, that extension shortcut is reset so I need to assign it again. How do I stop that?

I'd prefer if the issue was dealt generally, but if specifics are needed it's about Stylus 1.5.30 on Firefox 111.0.1.

Thank you kindly for your assistance
